bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [22–23? August 1863]
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library
bibl.note: Louisa wrote this letter on a letter she received from George Washington Whitman. She forwarded George's letter to Walt Whitman and included this note on the verso of the last page of George's letter.

body.p: I write a few lines with Georges letter i received it last wensday and should have sent it before but i have not received the money he writes of going to send i think there must be something wrong about it if i dont get it to day perhaps he was orderdordered away before he could express it i thought maybeemaybe i should have to show the letter to the express but i will send it) mat says she gesses he is going to get married because he said use what i wanted and put the rest in the bank I shall put all i can doodo without in certainly but if he could see Andrew i know he would say mother give him some and let him go in the country if it will doo him good I went down there the other day but O walt how poverty stricken every thing looked it made me feel bad all night and so dirty every thing he thinks of going to rockland lake county next monday i hope it will doo him good we are quite well i feel middling well i am fatter than i was when you went away but i dont feel any better for it i think sometimes not as well i will write again soon i have had anotheanother letter from Heyd he says han is gradualy getting better but is not able to come home

postscript.p: miss hattie has torn this letter as usual
